dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1370002047 at Wed Jun 23 09:28:09 UTC 2021

panels.description:
pgbouncer sync connection pool Saturation per database node, for primary database connections.

Web/api/git applications use a separate connection pool to sidekiq.

When this resource is saturated, web/api database operations may queue, leading to rails worker
saturation and 503 errors in the web.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{user="gitlab", database="gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",stage="$stage",type="$type"}[5m]) +
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{user="gitlab", database="gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",stage="$stage",type="$type"}[5m]) +
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{user="gitlab", database="gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",stage="$stage",type="$type"}[5m]) +
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{user="gitlab", database="gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",stage="$stage",type="$type"}[5m])
      )
      / on(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) group_left()
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
        avg_over_time(pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{name="gitlabhq_production", env="$environment",stage="$stage",type="$type"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_sync_primary_pool component saturation: Postgres Sync (Web/API/Git) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node

panels.content:
## Postgres Sync (Web/API/Git) primary Connection Pool Utilization per Node

pgbouncer sync connection pool Saturation per database node, for primary database connections.

Web/api/git applications use a separate connection pool to sidekiq.

When this resource is saturated, web/api database operations may queue, leading to rails worker
saturation and 503 errors in the web.


## What to do from here here?

* Check the ${type} service overview dashboard (accessible from the menu above)
* [Find related issues on GitLab.com](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-com/gl-infra/-/issues?scope=all&state=all&label_name[]=GitLab.com+Resource+Saturation&search=pgbouncer_sync_primary_pool)
* [Create an issue in the Infrastructure Tracker](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/infrastructure/issues/new?issue[title]=Resource+Saturation:+pgbouncer_sync_primary_pool&issue[description]=/label+~"GitLab.com+Resource+Saturation")

Keep in mind that this is a **causal alert**. This means that this may not neccessarily
be leading to user impact. Check the alert list below for active symptom based
alerts incidating potential user impact.
panels.title: Help

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
    ALERTS{alert_type="symptom", type="${type}", environment="$environment", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
    or
    ALERTS{alert_type="symptom", type="${type}", environment="$environment", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
    or
    ALERTS{alert_type="symptom", type="${type}", environment="$environment", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
    or
    ALERTS{alert_type="symptom", type="${type}", environment="$environment", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (environment, alertname, severity)
)
